newsitem.title: USA: CME live cattle changes approved, June 1998 listed.
newsitem.headline: CME live cattle changes approved, June 1998 listed.

text.p: The Chicago Mercantile Exchange listed the June 1998 live cattle contract effective May 21 following approval of amendments to the live cattle contract by federal regulators this week, the CME said in a statement.

The CME said the Commodity Futures Trading Commission approved the proposed changes to the live cattle contract that were submitted on January 6, 1997. These amendments apply only to contracts listed after approval was granted. The June 1998 contract will be the first listed under the new specifications.
- Delivery premiums and discounts are now flexible and based on the weekly USDA report, National Premiums and Discounts for Slaughter Steers and Heifers.
- Allowable average, minimum and maximum live weights are increased by 50 lbs for live-graded deliveries.

- Spot month position limit is increased to 600 contracts from first notice day through the sixth business day prior to expiration. For the last five trading days, the position limit will be 300 contracts.
- The last trading day will be the last business day of the month.
